TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed PenLineCap extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Describes the shape at the end of a line or segment.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following illustration shows the available cap styles for lines or segments. The red portion of the line shows the extra area added by the line cap setting.
![PenLineCap settings](~/add/media/wcpsdk-graphicsmm-linecaps.png "PenLineCap settings") Line caps

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.PenLineCap Flat = int32(0)

Docs.summary: A cap that does not extend past the last point of the line. Comparable to no line cap.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.PenLineCap Round = int32(2)

Docs.summary: A semicircle that has a diameter equal to the line thickness.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.PenLineCap Square = int32(1)

Docs.summary: A rectangle that has a height equal to the line thickness and a length equal to half the line thickness.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Media.PenLineCap Triangle = int32(3)

Docs.summary: An isosceles right triangle whose base length is equal to the thickness of the line.
